OCC.DAT:
^BEGIN_DEVICE Unicode Printer
^^ This identifies the device as a printer installed in Windows. ^^ It will enable automatic page size determination, font scaling, ^^ image printing, etc. Note that this can only be used when the ^^ selected queue is 'PrintMan'.
MSW type
^^ Device modes can use three different syntaxes for Windows printers:
^^ mode_n(cols,rows) Fixed page size (e.g. for labels) ^^ mode_n(0, scale) Auto page size with font scaling ^^ mode_n(0, scale)[opts,copies] Auto page size with font scaling, ^^ options and multiple copies. ^^ opts=2: landscape ^^ opts=4: draft mode ^^ Combine options by adding them.
^^ If you want accurate printing on pre-printed stock, use a fixed ^^ page size (i.e. first syntax) and select a device font (indicated ^^ by a printer icon) in the setup dialogs for best results.
^NUL mode_0(0,100) ^NUL mode_1(0,100)[2,1] ^NUL mode_2(0,75) ^NUL mode_3(0,75)[2,1] ^NUL mode_4(0,100)[4,1] ^NUL mode_5(0,50)[4,1] ^NUL mode_6(40,6) Big labels ^NUL mode_7(32,4) Small labels
^^ Sequences to control print features. Features can be disabled by ^^ simply specifying a ^NUL sequence, e.g. "^NUL inverse".
^ESC^FF formfeed ^ESC^CR return ^ESC^LF linefeed
^ESC^001 normal ^ESC^002 bold ^ESC^003 italic ^ESC^004 underline ^ESC^005 bol_ita ^ESC^006 bol_und ^ESC^007 ita_und ^ESC^008 bol_ita_und
^ESC^020 novideo ^ESC^021 blink ^ESC^022 high ^ESC^023 inverse ^ESC^024 underscore ^ESC^025 bli_hig ^ESC^026 bli_inv ^ESC^027 bli_und ^ESC^028 hig_inv ^ESC^029 hig_und ^ESC^030 inv_und ^ESC^031 bli_hig_inv ^ESC^032 bli_hig_und ^ESC^033 bli_inv_und ^ESC^034 hig_inv_und ^ESC^035 bli_hig_inv_und
^END_DEVICE
^BEGIN_SET 0 ^^ ANSI Character Set ^ESC^100 select ^CHR ^REPEAT ^CHR/8 ^REPEAT ^END_SET
^BEGIN_SET 1 ^^ Unicode CharacterSet
^ESC^101 select ^UTF-8 ^REPEAT ^END_SET
